page.title: 11 POPULATION IN THE AREA
page.content: East Budleigh is the largest settlement. Its population in 1981 was 82O. From 68O in 1931,it dropped as agricultural employment opportunities declined,but rose from 1961 to 1971 with increasing popularity for retirement and homes for commuters; the latter are an increasingly mobile group.Now,around 5O% of the population are retired and our survey showed that 46% of those questioned had lived in the village for only 1Oyrs or less.This is a feature of East Devon's population.Yettington is a small hamlet of some 2O houses;many are farms and others are being gentrified.The remaining people in the area live on scattered farms.There is a large temporary population with the students of Bicton College and summer influx of tourists and other students. BY A.Kain & A.level Geography group.
